DataProcessingMethod.name: Active
DataProcessingMethod.description: a company or organization gathers information that a user knowingly and intentionally provides. This involves instances where users actively input data, such as filling out a web form, creating an account, making a purchase, or subscribing to a newsletter. Explicit data collection typically requires the user to be fully aware of the information being provided and often involves their direct consent.

DataProcessingMethod.name: Passive
DataProcessingMethod.description: refers to the process by which a company or organization gathers information passively, without the user actively providing it. This type of data collection occurs automatically in the background, often as a byproduct of the user's interaction with a website, app, or service. Examples include tracking user activity through cookies, logging IP addresses, collecting device information, or recording browsing behavior and preferences.

DataProcessingMethod.name: Unspecified
DataProcessingMethod.description: It is not specified or unclear whether the information is collected explicitly or implicitly.
